>
>
>I would also like to obtain the status (did it failed?) of this  "testxxxxx"
>method.
>
these informations are stored into the TestResult object.  A hashtable 
contains all failed tests.  See the TestResult API for details.  But I 
don't think that you will be able to access this object in the teardown 
method of a testcase.  You may need to write your own TestListener to 
achieve this goal.

-Vladimir
subject: Re: [junit] ? access current test method name, in setUp() and tearDown()
